definition: place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish

sentences.english: He cut me to the quick with his unkind remark.
sentences.chinese: 他用無情的話刺到我的痛處。

sentences.english: XNA is the next sore point amongst VB developers.
sentences.chinese: XNA是在VB開發人員當中的下一個痛處。

sentences.english: In China, the issue of fake qualifications clearly touches a nerve here.
sentences.chinese: 唐駿假學歷問題顯然在中國觸到了痛處。

sentences.english: His biggest sore spot is his inability to listen to others.
sentences.chinese: 他最大的痛處在於無法聽進別人說的話。

sentences.english: The size issue is always a sore point within the industry.
sentences.chinese: 尺寸問題一直是時尚界的痛處。

sentences.english: Code readability has always been a sore point for me.
sentences.chinese: 代碼可讀性總是我的痛處。

definition: lit. to draw blood on the first prick (idiom)/fig. to hit the nail on the head
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to be left speechless/unable to respond
to have a close call/to have a narrow escape
faulty wording/mispronunciation due to a speech defect
see 百孔千瘡|百孔千疮[bai3 kong3 qian1 chuang1]
lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming)/to aggravate/to intensify
